Key Arguments: The legislation will damage free speech, which is a fundamental human right.
The definition of 'misinformation' is too subjective, particularly regarding what constitutes 'harm'.
Governments cannot effectively police subjective interpretations of harm.
The bill represents an extreme form of control over Australians' speech.
Notable Quotes: Free speech is a non-negotiable human right and must be safeguarded.
It is simply not possible for governments to police such subjectivity.
This proposed bill is an extreme version of this.
